title: JD.com Offers to Buy Ceconomy in Deal Valuing It at €2.2 Billion
summary: Chinese e-commerce firm JD.com Inc. offered to acquire Ceconomy AG in a deal that would value the German electronics retailer at about €2.2 billion ($2.5 billion).

title: Treasury secretary calls MAGA baby bonds a ‘back door’ to privatize Social Security
summary: A provision in the Republican megabill, which was signed into law earlier this month, giving each newborn $1,000 could be “a back door for privatizing Social Security,” Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Wednesday.
fullContent: A provision in the Republican megabill, which was signed into law earlier this month, giving each newborn $1,000 could be “a back door for privatizing Social Security,” Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Wednesday.

title: Grab Sales Top Estimates on Sustained Ride, Delivery Demand
summary: Grab Holdings Ltd. reported quarterly sales that beat analysts’ estimates, a sign of sustained demand for ride-hailing and delivery services in a Southeast Asian economy rattled by global trade tensions.
fullContent: Drivers with GrabFood deliver food in Jakarta. Photographer: Dimas Ardian/Bloomberg

title: Trump crypto group’s report skips strategic bitcoin reserve, but industry remains unfazed
summary: The report released Wednesday by President Donald Trump’s crypto working group offered no new details on the administration’s plans to establish a strategic crypto stockpile, including a bitcoin reserve. Still, industry participants appeared largely unfazed.
fullContent: The report released Wednesday by President Donald Trump’s crypto working group offered no new details on the administration’s plans to establish a strategic crypto stockpile, including a bitcoin reserve. Still, industry participants appeared largely unfazed.

title: Jim Cramer says he's confident about Starbucks' long-term potential. Here's why
summary: Jim Cramer is bullish on Starbucks due to CEO Brian Niccol’s progress on a turnaround plan, citing successful trials of the new “Green Apron Service.”
fullContent: Jim Cramer is bullish on Starbucks due to CEO Brian Niccol’s progress on a turnaround plan, citing successful trials of the new “Green Apron Service.”
